turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: 'Less the place really is haunted.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Nonsense! Just bad press. All the deaths that occurred inside -- my own father's included -- all perfectly normal fatal accidents.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're totally full of shit, aren't you?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: You'll never know 'til you walk through that door!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You said that was an accident.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I lied. The House is alive and we're all gonna die.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So, what? You're saying we're stuck here the rest of our lives?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: A cleaning crew's supposed to arrive at 9:30 tomorrow morning -- I think the power of the house fades at dawn.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- well, let's hear it for small miracles --

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: -- but I imagine we'll all be mutilated beyond recognition by then.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What's in there?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What is it? What's in there?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: The Soul of the House. Everything that's corrupt about it... My father trapped it in there just before he died. You see, he purchased the house to restore it... We were going to live here... Nothing can live here. I was just a kid... The first time I saw it, I thought it was beautiful... It was just a dark mist turning into the corner of the room... then it started to move... then death started to happen... First the workers.. six in all... then my father...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So you're saying as long as that door stays locked, we're okay?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Hell NO!! The House will kill ya!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: New wrinkle on an old theory for treating schizophrenia. 19th Century, I think: what would drive a sane man mad should make a madman sane. The Vannacutt version was: bombard the patient with aural and visual stimuli far more frightening than any hallucination they could ever produce, it'd traumatize 'em back to "normalcy."

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Did it work?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Hey! Where'd you guys go?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Left, goddamnit!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- of this place, goddamnit, Pritchett!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What's down there?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: The...Fourth of July.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Shit, Pritchett!!!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Price didn't make the guest list... The house did. It wants vengeance.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How's a goddamn building gonna send out invitations?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: What's life, anyway? Waves...? Sound...? Light...? Electricity...? I don't know... Phone lines...?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Oh. Jesus.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Poor Mr. Price --

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Uhhhh...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Okay -- I'll admit it: I'm totally, clinically insane. But I'm still the only one who actually got a check tonight. It's yours -- if you just get me the hell out of here now.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Hail Mary, full of grace -- the house is growing!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's not going to let us out!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: If you know where it is, get there!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Me? You've gotta be kidding.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Pritchett, is that you?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Up here --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Pritchett!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Over here!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Right here, Mr. Pritchett. As well as five other bona fide, bank drafts for one million dollars each. Made out to cash.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And we get this money when?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: The second the sun hits tomorrow morning. Assuming you have stayed the entire night - and you're still alive, of course. Any other questions?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This is nuts.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Yeah. But, hey, anybody who's not "comfortable" with the rules, you're free to walk, anytime. Seven digits poorer, goes without saying.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I'll meet you down there.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Take the gun.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Evelyn, could you just zip it for a moment? It looks like we're stuck here 'til morning -- let's make the best of it.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Best of a nightmare.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Married. Once. Same woman. All these years. She just slithered up the stairs.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Prove it.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Prove it how?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Oh, Jesus....

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Adrenaline -- in your bag, Blackburn, you must have --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- the stained glass --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- yeah, we did that --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- closed.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Pritchett, you're not joining this necktie party?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Is she...alright?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I thought she was dead. For sure.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: And you're not really as large and useless as you seem.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm better than that.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Don't push it.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Three steps forward -- I want to get up there.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: This whole place can't be wired to just one circuit --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Most fun I've had all day.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: You need to get out more.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What? Deep down inside?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Start with the name you were born with, and we'll work forward from there.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I told you already: Jennifer Jenzen, Executive V.P. of --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't think so...

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Most of my business is making deliveries to high rollers. And I have yet to meet one Executive who could tie their own shoes -- let alone rewire an entire house. You don't fit the bill -- not even close.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: There's always exceptions.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Not in the movie biz. So, c'mon, gimme the truth.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, she went somewhere! She didn't just up and disappear into thin air!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: No...not air --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How you gonna manage that with a new blow-hole in your dome?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Hey, if everybody's gonna kill each other, could you do it in another room? I'm trying to get something accomplished here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What the hell good is fixing that gonna get us?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: An answer, I hope: exactly what -- or who -- Melissa was taping.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And then where are we?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You hear somebody?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: No -- keep pulling, it's moving!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: We can do it...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Sure, with three days and a blowtorch.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: It's a thousand years old -- we just need a crowbar or something to get leverage -- the sucker'll pop!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No prob: I'll just hop down the hardware store --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- no. The basement -- the room with all the controls to this thing: big long iron levers just lying there --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- not a chance -- there's too much weirdness down there I don't think even bullets are gonna stop.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: You're starting to sound like Pritchett.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I was upstairs with Eddie --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- that's the fact, bud --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- where the hell were you?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: -- you lose either way, Price --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- listen to the man --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I think we should have taken a right back there.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Back where?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Good point.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Let's try down here...

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What are you looking for?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Maybe there are notes or drawings of this place, showing how those plates work.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Cheery looking bunch.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Better living through electricity.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Holy shit! Now we know how the guest list was made up. Look, these names... Head Nurse, Ruth-Ann Stockard... Bjorn Jensen, Electro Therapy... Jasper Marr, Thomas Steven Price... They're all here!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Wait a minute... What are you saying?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Everyone that was invited is related to one of the staff who was here when the place burned. There are five of us...

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Or an on-line computer.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That's crazy!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What about that other guy?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This is the best we're gonna do.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: It'll have to do.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Price!!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: He's gotta still be down here.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's okay, everything's okay now.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: He's dead...?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Don't think it's even an issue.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: We're safe?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What --

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: -- was that??

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: The opening's still too small, we'll never get through!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: For chrissake give me a hand!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: No. It's just trying to frighten us.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's succeeding!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: All the plates sealing the windows and doors -- there's got to be some way of raising them manually. They didn't just appear out of thin air -- there's got to be pulleys, cables or something, that make them go up and down.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Where did it go?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Run.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Yeah. And under other abnormal circumstances, I think this would be the time to seriously jump your bones.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Better put it on hold 'til we find Pritchett.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I don't do groups.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: ...Jesus H. Christ.

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: So where's the party?

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: I knew this whole place'd be pure gold! Pritchett, point me in the direction of the goddamn ghosts! If I can get something bizarre enough on tape, I think I can parlay it into getting me some kind'a Robert Stack "Unsolved Most- Wacked-Out Home Videos" gig. No more five afternoons a week of sex-change- Nazis-and-the-lesbos-that-love-'em.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You've got your own TV show?

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: The guy whose hair I do has his own TV show. All I've got is a blow-dryer and a dream.

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: ...birds. Just seagulls or something walking on the glass, goddammit.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Cheer up: before the night's through, I'm sure one of us'll get hacked to pieces by somebody or something.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: So, what? The thing with the glass? Price did that?

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: I hope not.

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: Melissa Margaret Marr, Celebrity.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Eddie Moses, Communications Attache -- which translated from ancient bullshit means: I work for a Messenger service.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Then what the hell are we doing here?

turns.speaker: MELISSA
turns.text: How'd you make your guest list, Price: throw darts at a phone book?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- forget it. Last birthday the Manson Family Ranch, the year before that: Jonestown.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh. You think this is a request. Well, think again. I'm telling you: "Haunted Hill" is exactly where we're having my party this year. You'll find the guest list on your desk by the time you get back --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Don't touch me!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I'm impressed: I don't think Evelyn's ever said those words to anything with genitalia.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm not laughing, Steven.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: You shouldn't be -- you were nearly just killed, sweetheart.  And now that our birthday girl is finally here, let the games begin!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Haven't they already?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Could we have a word?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Oh, I think we're going to have several.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I gave you a goddamn guest list two pages long -- where the hell are they?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Shredded. Sorry. Decided to whip up one of my own: a group so hungry for money that they'd be willing to do anything. I thought you'd be more comfortable with your peers.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I guess it was stupid of me not to expect something this twisted from you. Well, congratu-fucking-lations, Steven: Round One, you win.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Well, not quite. See, those people down there: they aren't the ones I invited.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Then who are they?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: You tell me. I don't know how you managed to hack into my Mac, but: bravo.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What are you talking about? You think I invited them?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Sure know it wasn't me. And if you say it wasn't you -- then who the hell did, Evelyn?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It you really loved me, Steven, you'd find a way to drop dead in the next three seconds.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Finding ways for me to die at these things is really your deal, isn't it? The "O.J." knife with the not-quite- retractable blade? Your "Jim Jones Kool- Aid" that was exactly that?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: All accidents until proven otherwise.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: You know how happy I'd be if that was really true, Evelyn? And how positively goddamn delirious if you weren't fucking every living thing in our area code at the same goddamn time!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Which part of that fantasy turns you on most: me with other men -- or just the other men?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: You know everything you do gets me hot.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- just not always in the sexual sense.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You're hurting me.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Now, there's the simple country gal I married. Let's go back down and greet your guests -- show them the real you: corny as Kansas on the Fourth of July.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: My guests were shredded. It's your sick little scene now, Steven: enjoy. I'm going to go run scalding water on the places you just touched me, and then I'm calling a cab.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- asking the wrong guy -- wasn't me who closed it.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Sure it wasn't. Hey, anybody else here make their living with thrills'n'chills for the kiddies? Don't raise your hands all at once.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Huh. And here I had a completely different theory.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Really? Well, let it rip.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Oh, no-no-no -- much more bang for everyone's buck to nail the bitch --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- the sadistic prick --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- in the act.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Must be getting old, Stevie -- you're repeating yourself -- this is the exact same set-up you used for the Son-Of-Sam Hunt back in '94.  Girlie, open up that casket there and see what you find.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: So how's a girl to know if these things are loaded, baby?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Only one way I can think of, Sweetheart.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And where are we off to, Mr. Price? Check the wiring on the animatronic Mummies?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: A simple leak, if it's okay with you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Fine with me. Just somebody then better go and round up Melissa Marr.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Stalking the wild poltergeist.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Game, set and match, Steven. You've outdone yourself. And I know it's not good manners to ask the magician how he did it, but inquiring minds are desperate to know: just what did really happen to Ms. Marr?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Asking the wrong person again.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I mean, did she stage it all for you and then go hide -- or did you just flat out kill the little bitch --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- I pose you the same question --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- and who's next on your list?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: If I had one, Evelyn, I think you know who'd be first and last --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- oh, for chrissake, that's a given; we all know that knocking me off is the bottom line here --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- that wasn't my original plan, but it is starting to look more attractive --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- thank you! All the cards finally on the goddamn table!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Question answered.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: They weren't loaded when I put them in there!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Funky little house, ain't it?  Friends, your hostess is now going to retire for what's left of the night. If you need me, I'll be in the bedroom upstairs -- but try and fight that need: the door'll be locked, I'll be trying to sleep, and if anyone so much as breathes in the keyhole, I'm gonna empty this thing into their fucking head. Thank you all for the bestest birthday a girl could have.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Steven --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- anything, sweetheart, you need only speak --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- what...are...you...going...to --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- just what you wanted everyone here to believe in the first place: I'm going to murder you, Evelyn, with the greatest of pleasure --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: -- wit...nesses --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- witnesses to what? You're already dead, Evelyn! Happy Birthday, baby --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No. OhmyGod, Pritchett was right -- The house IS haunted.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Evelyn... Get up... NOW!

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Steven??

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I don't know, Ms. Jenzen.

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: Well, who's the damn thing <u>from</u>?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Messenger just dropped it off. No return address.

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: You didn't think to ask?

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: I was in the middle of --

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: -- being utterly fucking useless, what else is new.

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: You think this is fucking funny??

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: No, no, it's just --

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: -- well, here's a better one: you're fired.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: And here's your goddamn severance!

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: ...wow....WOW! Hey, Ms. Jenzen -- ?

turns.speaker: JENZEN
turns.text: Are you still fucking here??

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: Business or pleasure, Mr. Price?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: My wife. Where were we?

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: Your roller coaster that is, quote: "unlike any that has ever come before it."

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Absolutely. No cheap thrills. A genuine Journey To The Brink Of Madness.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Ever seen one that starts at the top? 20 stories worth of top?

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: And then what happens?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I think it's something better experienced then described.

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: Sources have told this reporter that the real reason your Park's opening has been delayed was a near-fatal accident on one of the rides here. Comment?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I wouldn't be opening this place tomorrow if every single thing down to the beheaded Beanie Babies hadn't tested 100% safe.

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: First time for everything.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I've designed and built six of these places -- take my word for it, everything's fine.

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: Do something!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Like what?? This isn't supposed to be happening!!

turns.speaker: KIRSTEN
turns.text: Please! Something! Oh-God!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Maybe if I --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: She's been marked for it. The House does that. Happened to Pritchett's father. Likely happen to you all. Isn't that what you told me, Mr. Pritchett?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I can't remember at the moment.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I'm ready now.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Alright, Mr. Pritchett, let me just sign the damn thing.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: -- it's getting older by the second. Mr. Price, if I could just please have --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Sorry, Pritchett, here you go.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I think you're gonna miss the bash of a lifetime --

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: -- my loss --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- even if I give you a million as well?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Wouldn't know what to do with it all --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Must be those plates -- interfering with the signal somehow.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Not the plates: the House. Why is no one listening to me?? It's alive!  And once it's made up its mind, it won't let anything out.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I think...I may have the answer.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I remember...it was a long time ago...my father said: when the House was finally completed, make sure...we-christen-it- with-this-bottle-of-dirt-cheap-champagne- that-should-still-be-in a cupboard somewhere!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: House 2, Guests 0.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I think, Pritchett, we've got a situation here that even you can't explain away as "ghosts." This is ice- cold homicide by person -- or persons --

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: -- then I guess then it had to be you. Sorry.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Thank God -- I was afraid I'd be lynched without a quorum.

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: Vannacutt!!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Or somebody wanting me to believe that.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: He was right! Pritchett was right!

turns.speaker: PRITCHETT
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Yeah. Why's there five checks? There's only four of us.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: You're forgetting my lovely wife; she's part of the same winner-take-all as the rest of you.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: What're you talking about?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Oh, sorry. Detail I guess I forgot to mention. You die, you lose. Your check gets divvied-up by those still amongst the living.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Jennifer-Jenzen-Executive-V.P.- Paragon-Pictures.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Very good. Well, I think I can say with complete honesty: I've never heard of any of you.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: This is all maybe getting a little too strange --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: -- I wouldn't worry, Ms. Jenzen: the unexplainable will probably explain herself before too long. In the meantime, let's all relax, have a drink, the evening's young --

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: SARA
turns.text: Good way to get your head blown off.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: I'll try not to remember to warn Evelyn.
